alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 1:38PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Carbon County through 230 PM MDT... At 138 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sinclair, or 8 miles east of Rawlins, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rawlins, Sinclair, Seminoe Campground and Seminoe Dam. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 215 and 236. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Upper North Platte River Basin
